page.title: 01Cefn Du and Cwm-y-Glo
page.content: A rounded hill called Cefn Du which rises to 441 metres is to be found to the centre and south west of this area. It is covered with rough grassland. Along its north and westerly side lies a narrow road dotted with small farms and cottages. To the east where the land drops down more steeply the slopes have deciduous woodland on them. At the foot of the hill but away from the flood plain of Afon Rhythallt lies a small village called Cwm Y Glo. There is a caravan park and a victorian "castle" and garden of tourist interest close to the village.
